text: Duiven is a railway station located in Duiven, Netherlands. The station was opened on 15 February 1856 and is located on the Oberhausen–Arnhem railway between Arnhem and Elten (Germany). The train services at this station are operated by Arriva and Breng. The station was closed on 4 October 1936, but reopened on 31 May 1980. ICE services pass through this station at high speed. ==Train services== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:85%;" ! Route ! Service type ! Operator ! Notes |- | Arnhem - Doetinchem - Winterswijk | Local ("Sprinter") | Arriva | 2x per hour (only 1x per hour after 20:00, on Saturday mornings and Sundays) |- | Arnhem - Doetinchem | Local ("Sprinter") | Breng | 2x per hour - Mon-Fri only. Not on evenings. |} ==Bus services== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:85%;" ! Line ! Route ! Operator ! Notes |- | 62 | Arnhem CS - Westervoort - Duiven Station - Duiven Centerpoort Noord | Breng, TCR (only a couple of runs) | On evenings and weekends, this bus does not operate between Duiven Station and Centerpoort Noord. |- | 862 | Arnhem Willemsplein → Westervoort → Duiven Station → Duiven Noord | Breng | Only 2 runs on Saturday late nights. A special tariff applies. |} ==External links== *NS website *Dutch Public Transport journey planner Category:Railway stations in Gelderland Category:Railway stations opened in 1856 Category:Railway stations on the Rhijnspoorweg Category:Duiven Category:1856 establishments in the Netherlands
title: Duiven railway station
